contextId.information: The woman bowed down before Elisha as a sign of great respect and appreciation. AT: "Then she bowed in front of Elisha with her face to the ground to show him her gratitude" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: Then she lay facedown on the ground at his feet and bowed to the ground

contextId.information: Often people would rip their clothes if they were in great distress. AT: "he ripped his clothes to show his distress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
The priest poured olive oil on the head of Joash as a symbol that he was now the king. AT: "poured some olive oil on Joash's head" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
She tore her clothes to express that she was very upset and angry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This is a symbolic action that indicates intense grief or sadness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
